definition: to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: I'm confused. Should I go to an optometrist or ophthalmologist for my eye exam?
sentences.chinese: 我應該看驗光師還是眼科醫師，作眼鏡查抄時？

sentences.english: Review reserved tables and names of such; follow up on special arrangements for pre-assigned tables according to standards.
sentences.chinese: 查抄預定的桌子環境和客人姓名，跟進特別的擺設。

sentences.english: This centrifuge power unit must be rechecked.
sentences.chinese: 這臺離心機的動力裝置必需重新查抄。

sentences.english: The eosinophil increase can always be found out via routine blood inspections.
sentences.chinese: 血常規查抄常有嗜酸性粒細胞增多。

sentences.english: Your NYE begins when you check into your room.
sentences.chinese: 您夫奈起頭當你查抄到你的房間。

sentences.english: Check for any obstructions and signs of damage to the leaf and debris filter.
sentences.chinese: 查抄任何障礙和毀壞葉子和雜物過濾器地跡象。

sentences.english: Finished, he picked up a hand mirror to check out the back of his head.
sentences.chinese: 完成了，他拿起了一個手鏡查抄一下他的後腦。

sentences.english: The police raided their gambling house.
sentences.chinese: 警察查抄了他們的賭窟。

sentences.english: The reasons for the seizure "are not very clear", she said.
sentences.chinese: 她表示不清楚這次查抄的原因。

sentences.english: Check the paper size and paper to determine the paper-feed tray.
sentences.chinese: 查抄紙，猜測紙尺寸與送紙器抵髑。

definition: to search a house and confiscate possessions
to search and confiscate
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to confiscate
to torture
to imprison
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to smuggle
to investigate thoroughly
to execute the whole family and confiscate their property
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
Imperial Household Department (in Qing dynasty)
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
estate/lands
